title: Dark Souls III
review: Dark Souls III holds a special place in my heart. I love the game very much but due to the amount of times I insist upon restarting I still haven't finished it, maybe this year is the year. Regardless I love this game play it if you like games that are punishing.

title: Resident Evil 2 (1998)
review: When I was younger I tried playing this game but the fixed camera angles proved too alien for me to master. As an adult coming back to it I've found that all it takes is a change of mindset. I think it is fun, like most games from this era incredibly difficult especially if you've been pampered like me by gentle game design in recent years. The music is also so cool.

title: Fortnite
review: Perhaps it is controversial but I love Fortnite. While I am capable of recognizing the negative implications of games as a service, and "micro"transactions, I still enjoy this game. It is very fun and always fresh with content, pretty much how I relax after work/school at this point.

title: Elden Ring
review: Elden ring is so good. Just like Dark Souls in its brutal punishing nature but also so fresh and fun. Discovering things in this game for the first time and not knowing what comes next is a genuine treat.

title: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain
review: I came back to this game this year because of the recent Metal Gear resurgance I have been victim of online. I really find this game fun, while that can be controversial I think that this game is fun for what it is and I think little about what it could have been. It certainly lacks some of the spark that the other games in the series have, but I think its good in a different way.

title: Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater
review: I am actually shocked that I beat this game, I am so bad when it comes to committing to a full playthough of a game. I had a lot of fun with it.

title: Metal Gear Solid
review: I am not terribly far along in this game but I enjoy it so far. I am on a bit of a Metal Gear Kick

title: Minecraft
review: One of my favorite games ever. Another game that has been catching a lot of negative critisism as of late, but it brings me a lot of comfort and joy.

title: Noita
review: Noita is so good. Very difficult yet rewarding. It begs for you to try and exploit the games mechanics to your advantage. Super fun.

title: FTL
review: Good, fun, simple yet complicated. I come back to this one every once in a while.
